summary:
I provide short updates on Twitter rather than on LinkedIn.

Dr Ganna Rozhnova is an Associate Professor in Infectious Disease Modeling at the Julius Center of the UMC Utrecht. Her research centers on the application of infectious disease modeling to answer questions and support evidence-based policymaking in public health. She is interested in the emergence, evolution and spatio-temporal dynamics of infectious diseases as well as in the evaluation of interventions on disease transmission. Her most recent research aims to address the prospects of HIV elimination, the impact of promising HIV cure strategies on HIV transmission, and dynamics of SARS-CoV-2. Other applications include influenza, CMV, and childhood infections.

Dr Rozhnova is a recipient of highly competitive awards (PhD and postdoctoral FCT fellowships, Award "Stimulus for Research" from Calouste Gulbenkian Foundation), institutional excellence programs (Research Career Development Program) and grants. She held official appointments as an invited visiting scientist at the University of California (Santa Barbara, USA), the Newton Institute for Mathematical Sciences (Cambridge, UK), the Gladstone Institute of Immunology and Virology (San Francisco, USA), and the MRC Biostatistics Unit (Cambridge, UK). See the full list of fellowships and awards here: 
https://www.umcutrecht.nl/en/research/researchers/rozhnova-ganna-g

Side Activities:
- Associate Editor, Communications Medicine, Nature Portfolio
- Associate Editor, Mathematical Biosciences, Epidemiology and Public Health specialty section, Elsevier
- Editorial Board Member, Frontiers in Epidemiology, Infectious Disease Epidemiology specialty section
Member, Young Academy, University Medical Center Utrecht
- Associate Member, Centre for Complex Systems Studies, Utrecht University
- Member, European Women in Mathematics
- Member, Institute of Physics
- Member, Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics

Publications:
- Romijnders K, de Groot L, Vervoort S, Basten M, van Welzen B, Kretzschmar M, Reiss P, Davidovich U, Rozhnova G. Journal of Virus Eradication 8(1), 100066 (2022). 
- Viana J, van Dorp CH, Nunes A, Gomes MC, van Boven M, Kretzschmar ME, Veldhoen M, Rozhnova G. Nature Communications 12, 3674 (2021).
- Rozhnova G, van Dorp CH, Bruijning-Verhagen P, Bootsma MCJ, van de Wijgert JHHM, Bonten MJM, Kretzschmar ME. Nature Communications 12, 1614 (2021). 
- Teslya A, Pham TM, Godijk NG, Kretzschmar ME, Bootsma MCJ, Rozhnova G. PLoS Medicine 17(7), e1003166 (2020).
- Rouzine IM, Rozhnova G. PLoS Pathogens 14(9), e1007291 (2018).

profile_positions.description:
• Built a team of national and international collaborators and established new interdisciplinary research at the interface of modeling, epidemiology and data analysis
• Organized bi-weekly journal club at Utrecht University
• Invited visiting scientist in MRC Biostatistics Unit at Cambridge University (06/2016—02/2017) 
• Wrote annual and final reports to funding agencies, weekly progress reporting to senior management
• Received two research grants as project leader and three grants as project participant 
• Supervised projects and lectured in MSc course “Mathematical modeling of infectious diseases” and "Molecular epidemiology of infectious diseases"
• Mentored and supervised 2 MSc and 1 PhD student in Biostatistics and Epidemiology
• Deliverables: 9 articles in peer-reviewed journals (8 as 1st and corresponding and 1 as last author) and 3 submitted manuscripts (2 as 1st author), 17 presentations


http://www.umcutrecht.nl/en/Research/Researchers/Rozhnova-Ganna-G

profile_positions.description:
• Conducted research on several interdisciplinary projects where a biological problem was solved through analytical modeling and data analysis (e.g. developed a model for HIV gene engineering therapy)
• Awarded a postdoctoral fellowship, Portuguese Foundation for Science and Technology (2010—2013), Contract No. SFRH/BPD/69137/2010
• Established collaborations and held visiting appointments at Kavli Institute for Theoretical Physics, Santa Barbara (03/2011), Oxford University (10/2012-11/2012), Princeton University (01/2013) and Gladstone Institute of Virology and Immunology, University of California, San Francisco (02/2013) 
• Organized two one-day international workshops (about 40 people each)
• Supervised two MSc in Physics projects
• Deliverables: 1st and corresponding author of 4 articles in peer-reviewed journals, 25 presentations

Old webpage: https://web.archive.org/web/20140919013405/www.theory.physics.manchester.ac.uk/~rozhnova/research.html

volunteer_experiences.description:
I have been reviewing articles for a number of mathematical, physics, engineering, medical and biological journals, and conferences.

Physics & Math: Physical Review Letters, Physical Review E, Europhysics Letters, New Journal of Physics, Journal of Statistical Physics, Physics Letters A, Journal of Physics A: Mathematical and Theoretical, Physica A: Statistical Mechanics and its Applications, Journal of Engineering Mathematics, Physica Scripta, Mathematical Biosciences, Bulletin of Mathematical Biology, Mathematical Biosciences and Engineering

Biology: Ecology Letters, Journal of Theoretical Biology, PLOS ONE, Vaccine, PLOS Pathogens, Ecological Complexity, AIDS

Conferences: International Multi-Conference on Complexity, Informatics and Cybernetics (IMCIC), International Symposium on Integrating Research, Education, and Problem Solving (IREPS), etc.

I am a regular participant of social activities for international staff of Utrecht University, the Utrecht Medical Centre and related research institutions, organised by the International Neighbour Group.

The Faculty Club is the place where I meet up with members of the academic community and our Dutch and international guests. I am a regular participant of both informal and business meetings organized by the Club.

Fully certified by NKBV in indoor lead climbing, trad multipitch rock climbing, multipitch waterfall ice climbing. I aim to make one ascent per holiday season! My previous successful alpine climbs include: Kilimanjaro (5,895 m, Tanzania), Aconcagua (6,962 m, Argentina), Alpamayo (5,947 m, Peru), Mont Blanc (4,810 m, France) and Elbrus (5,642 m, Russia).
I had a pleasure to be involved in all training activities of Hellas Athletics Running Club. My best achievement with them was running my first Marathon in Utrecht in 2016 (4h30m).
As a member of Institute of Physics I could stay informed about the latest news, attend relevant events and build collaborations in my research area.

company.name: Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics (SIAM)

volunteer_experiences.description: As a member of international community of applied and computational mathematicians, computer scientists, and other scientists and engineers I contributed to building cooperation between industry, government, laboratories, and academia.

Volunteered to search for and to scan numerous books for the electronic library of the Department of Mechanics and Mathematics of the Moscow State University. Moderated the online scientific forum of the Department.
Library: http://lib.mexmat.ru/
Forum: https://dxdy.ru/
